cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 345 mi W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn N-NE, cross the Florida Big Bend Thursday, then accelerate NEward just offshore the SE and Mid-Atlantic coast before moving well out into the Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast between Anclote River and Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Indian Pass FL; Tropical Storm Watch west of Indian Pass to the Walton/Bay County line FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast first, then the U.S. East Coast from northern Florida through the Carolinas and offshore of the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<5%) of tropical-storm-force winds late Saturday into Sunday; otherwise breezy conditions.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain possible Saturday night-Sunday as Hermineâ€™s remnants pass offshore.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None significant expected for port operations at this time.
